Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: This file was provided by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and is part of the X3D Conformance Test Suite, available at http://www.nist.gov/vrml.html The information contained within this file is provided for use in establishing conformance to the ISO VRML97 Specification. Conformance to this test does not imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Page.description: Test browser support of 16000 heights for ElevationGrid. A 125 by 128 ElevationGrid is drawn in the local coordinate system. This will result in grid with 16000 heights as required by the VRML specifications.
Page.name: heights16000
Page.title: heights 16000
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test ccw field. The same ElevationGrid is drawn twice (one in top of the other). For the top one the ccw and solid fields are both set to false (disabling backface culling). For the bottom one the ccw and solid fields are both set to true (enabling backface culling). The test should generate two ElevationGrids. The first one should show both sides of of the grid. The second one should only show the front side of the grid.
Page.name: test_ccwsolid
Page.title: test ccwsolid
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test face coloring using Color node. A 12 by 13 grid is defined in the local coordinate system. The ColorPerVertex field is set to false. There should be 12 colored horizontal rows. The colors should be (in order from the back): Red, Green, Blue, clear Blue, Yellow, Red, Green, Blue, clear Blue, Yellow, Red and Green.
Page.name: test_color
Page.title: test color
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test colorPerVertex set to true. This test attempts to color the vertices of an ElevationGrid. The colorPerVertex field is set to true and 156 colors are defined via a Color node.
Page.name: test_colorvertex
Page.title: test colorvertex
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test creaseAngle. This test draws the same ElevationGrid twice each one with a different value for the creaseAngle field. The top grid uses a creaseAngle value of 0.0, while the bottom one uses a creaseAngle value of 6.27 radians. This should cause the bottom grid to be drawn with smoother surfaces.
Page.name: test_creaseAngle
Page.title: test crease Angle
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser ability to completely map one ImageTexture onto the image texture should map once on the surface of the ElevationGrid. ImageTexture should map once onto the surface of the IndexedFaceSet, with the S (horizontal) axis of the texture corresponding to the X axis of the geometry.
Page.name: test_deftext
Page.title: test deftext
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test height field. A 12 by 13 ElevationGrid is drawn in the local coordinate system. All but ten heights are set to zero. The test should generate a grid with a total of ten heights above zero. There should be two heights of length 2.0 (back), three heights of length 1.5, three heights of length 1.0 and two heights of length 0.7 meters. Heights should be drawn in size order (from taller) in the back to lowest (at front).
Page.name: test_height
Page.title: test height
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test negative heights. This test attempts to draw an ElevationGrid using positive and negative values for the height field. The test should generate a grid with ten heights > 0. The rest of the heights should be 0.
Page.name: test_negheights
Page.title: test negheights
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test apply normals to the quadrilateral of an ElevationGrid. The test should generate a montanious looking grid with a default colored surface with a darken ground and lighted mountains.
Page.name: test_normalfaces
Page.title: test normalfaces
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test apply normals to the vertices of an ElevationGrid. The test should generate a flat default colored surface. The outside part of the surface should be illuminated, the The area immediatelly inside should be dark and the center of the surface should also be illuminated.
Page.name: test_normalvertices
Page.title: test normalvertices
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser ability to completely map one ImageTexture onto the image texture should map once on the surface of the ElevationGrid. ImageTexture should map once onto the surface of the IndexedFaceSet, with the S ( horizontal ) axis of the texture corresponding to the X axis of the geometry. A set of texture coordinates are used to apply
Page.name: test_textcoord
Page.title: test textcoord
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test illustrates the effect of redefining the zSpacing field for the same ElevationGrid. The same grid is drawn three times increasing the xSpacing field by one from the back to the front. Each grid is rotated 1.0 radians along the X axis to better illustrate such effect.
Page.name: test_xSpacing
Page.title: test x Spacing
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test illustrates the effect of redefining the zSpacing field for the same ElevationGrid. The same grid is drawn three times increasing the zSpacing field by one from top to bottom. Each grid is rotated 1.0 radians along the Y axis to better illustrate such effect.
Page.name: test_zSpacing
Page.title: test z Spacing
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using mostly default values. The test should generate a box of size 1.
Page.name: default_extrusion
Page.title: default extrusion
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using the minimum required number of points. The number of points in crossSection * number of points in spine <= 2500 (100 * 25 = 2500). The test should generate a "U" shaped like extrusion.
Page.name: points2500
Page.title: points 2500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using mostly default values. The test should generate an extruded circle with radius 2 and no begin cap.
Page.name: test_begincap
Page.title: test begincap
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using mostly default values. The test should generate an extruded circle with radius 2 and no begin and ending caps.
Page.name: test_beginendcap
Page.title: test beginendcap
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using mostly default values. The test should generate an extruded circle with radius 2 and no begin cap.
Page.name: test_ccw
Page.title: test ccw
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to test the convex field of an Extrsusion. A convex Extrusion is drawn with the "convex" figure set to false. The Extrusion should be rendered as a creased cylinder-shaped object.
Page.name: test_convex
Page.title: test convex
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an open Extrusion (end and beginning crossSection values are not the same). The test should generate an extruded (extruded along the Y axis) circle of radius 1 with no beginning or end caps.
Page.name: test_creaseAngle
Page.title: test crease Angle
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using mostly default values. The test should generate an extruded circle of radius 2 and no end cap.
Page.name: test_endcap
Page.title: test endcap
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets a different (and incremental) orientation value for each point in the spine field. The test should generate a twisted square extruded along the Y axis.
Page.name: test_fullorient
Page.title: test fullorient
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test draws an Extruded circle of radius one along the Y axis. A different scale factor is applied to each point in the spine field. The test should generate an extruded circle that looks like a champange cope.
Page.name: test_multscaling
Page.title: test multscaling
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an open Extrusion (end and beginning crossSection values are not the same). The test should generate an extruded (extruded along the Y axis) circle of radius 1 with no beginning or end caps.
Page.name: test_openextrusion
Page.title: test openextrusion
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the same orientation value for all the points in the spine field. The test should generate the default square extruded along a straight line and with an orientation of 1.1 radians along the X axis.
Page.name: test_simpleorient
Page.title: test simpleorient
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test draws the same extruded circle twice. The one most to the right is scaled by a factor of two. No scaling is applied to the extruded circle most to the left.
Page.name: test_simplescaling
Page.title: test simplescaling
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test draws the same open Extrusion twice with different value for the solid field for each one. The extrusion at the top contains a solid field set to false while the one at the bottom sets the solid field to true. This should cause the bottom extrusion be drawn with no backface.
Page.name: test_solid
Page.title: test solid
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to map the VTS logo to an extruded circle.
Page.name: test_texture
Page.title: test texture
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion using a spine path along the X, Y and Z directions. The test should generate an extruded circle of radius 1 extruded along different directions and with no end or beginning caps.
Page.name: test_XYZextrusion
Page.title: test XYZextrusion
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to draw an Extrusion with spine values along the Y and Z axis. The test should generate an "elbow" like figure with no end or beginning caps.
Page.name: test_YZextrusion
Page.title: test YZextrusion
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field is set to true and the colorIndex is set valid indices for the Color node. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each face in the order given by the colorIndex Vertices are connected in a counter-clockwise direction. Faces are drawn and colored from left to right starting with the front face. The test should generate a solid multicolor cube with the right face colored Red and the left face colored Green. The rest of the faces should be colored as a transition of the Green and Red colors. (Green transitioning to Red).
Page.name: colorIndex_color
Page.title: color Index color
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the convex field to false for a figure that is not convex The solid field is set to false.
Page.name: convexFALSE
Page.title: convex FALSE
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the convex field to true for a figure that is not convex The solid field is set to false.
Page.name: convexTRUE
Page.title: convex TRUE
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field is set to true and the colorIndex field is set to empty. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each face in the order given by the coordIndex. Faces are drawn from left to right starting with the front figure. The colors (in used order) are Red and Green. The test should generate a solid cube. The left (front and back) vertices of the cube are colored Red and the right (front and back) vertices are colored Green. The right face should be Green and the left face should be Red. The rest of the faces should be a transition of Red to Green.
Page.name: coordIndex_color
Page.title: coord Index color
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of normalPerVertex field is set to true and the normalIndex field is set to empty. Under these conditions the normals are applied to each vertex in the order given by the coordIndex field. A +Z normal is defined for the upper front vertices, a +Y normal is defined for all the bottom vertices, a +X normal is defined for the back right (uppermost) vertex and a -X normal is defined for the back left (uppermost) vertex. The test should generate a figure with the upper vertices illuminated the most. The top, back and bottom sides should be dark when facing the headlight directly from the front.
Page.name: coordindex_normal
Page.title: coordindex normal
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test uses the default value for the creaseAngle field for an IndexedFaceSet (Sphere). This value (0.0) will result in rendering a faceted figure along adjacent faces.
Page.name: default_creaseangle
Page.title: default creaseangle
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This world tests browser ability to draw an IndexedFace set using mostly default values.
Page.name: default_faceset
Page.title: default faceset
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of texCoord field is set to NULL and a texture image is defined using an appearance node. Since there is no texCoord field, the browser should calculate a default texture coordinate mapping using the bounding box of the shape.
Page.name: default_texturecoord
Page.title: default texturecoord
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field is set to false and the colorIndex field is set to empty. Under such conditions the colors are applied to each face in the order given by the Color node. Faces are colored from left to right starting with the front face. The colors (in used order) are Red, Green, Blue and Yellow.
Page.name: empty_colorIndex
Page.title: empty color Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of normal field set not NULL, the normalPerVertex field is set to F ALSE and the normalIndex field is set to empty. Under these conditions the normals are applied to each face in the same order given by the normal field. Normals for the front, left and right faces are defined with the same orientation as the face, therefore these faces should be visible as the figure is rotated. Normals for the top, bottom and back faces are defined to point towards the inside of the cube, therefore these faces should not be visible at any time.
Page.name: empty_normalIndex
Page.title: empty normal Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of textCoord field set to valid values (and not NULL), the texCoordIndex field is set empty. Under these conditions the image texture is apply to the vertices in the IndexedFaceSet in the order given by the CoordIndex field.
Page.name: empty_textureIndex
Page.title: empty texture Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: This file was provided by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and is part of the X3D Conformance Test Suite, available at http://www.nist.gov/vrml.html The information contained within this file is provided for use in establishing conformance to the ISO VRML97 Specification. Conformance to this test does not imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Page.description: Test browser support of 5000 faces per IndexedFaceSet. A sine wave function graph is used to draw 5000 faces for a single IndexedFaceSet as required by section 7.3 of the VRML specifications.
Page.name: faces5000
Page.title: faces 5000
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field set to false and the colorIndex field is set to valid indices for each color in the Color node. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each face in the order given by the colorIndex field. Faces are drawn and colored from left to right starting with the front face. (Colors in used order are Blue, Yellow, Green, Red, Green and Red)
Page.name: filled_colorIndex
Page.title: filled color Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of normal field set to not NULL, the normalPerVertex ifield is set to false and the normalIndex field is set to not empty. Under these circumstances the normals are applied to each face in the order given by the normalIndex field. Normals for the front, back and bottom faces are defined with the same orientation as the face, therefore these faces should be visible as the figure is rotated. Normals for the top, left and right faces are defined to point towards the inside of the cube, therefore these faces should not be visible at any time.
Page.name: filled_normalIndex
Page.title: filled normal Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Tese of textCoord field set to valid values (and not NULL), the texCoordIndex field is set to valid values for the texCoord field. Under these conditions the image texture is apply to the vertices in the IndexedFaceSet in the order given by the texCoordIndex field.
Page.name: filled_textureIndex
Page.title: filled texture Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of normalPerVertex field set to true and the normalIndex field is set to valid indices for the normal field. Under these conditions the normals are applied to each vertex in the order given by the normalIndex field. A -Y normal is defined for all the top vertices, a +Z normal is defined for the lower front vertices, a +X normal is defined for the back right (lowermost) vertex and a -X normal is defined for the back left (lowermost) vertex. The test should generate a solid cube with the lower vertices illuminated the most. The back, top and bottom sides should be dark when facing the headlight directly from the front.
Page.name: normalindex_normal
Page.title: normalindex normal
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the solid field to false, therefore preventing the browser from doing backface culling. The tester should be able to see the backface of all faces. Each face is painted using a different color.
Page.name: nosolidshape
Page.title: nosolidshape
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of ccw field set to false and the faces are drawn in a clockwise direction. No texture mapping or color fields are set. The test should generate a non-solid cube with a Green diffuseColor.
Page.name: reversefaces_ccwFALSE
Page.title: reversefaces ccw FALSE
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests redefines the value for the creaseAngle for an IndexedFaceSet (sphere). This value (1.5) will result in rendering a smoother figure along adjacent faces.
Page.name: set_creaseangle
Page.title: set creaseangle
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests redefines the value for the creaseAngle for an IndexedFaceSet (sphere) to the maximum possibe value. This value (6.27) will result in rendering a really smooth figure along adjacent faces.
Page.name: setmax_creaseangle
Page.title: setmax creaseangle
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: A square figure is used to draw 10 vertices for a single face of an IndexedFaceSet as required by section 7.3 of the VRML specifications.
Page.name: vertices10
Page.title: vertices 10
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field set to true and the colorIndex field is set to valid indices for the color field. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each vertex in the order given by the colorIndex field. Lines are drawn and color in counter-clockswise direction (starting from the bottom leftmost vertex). Used colors are (in order) are Red, Green, Blue and Yellow.
Page.name: colorIndex_color
Page.title: color Index color
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field is set to true and the colorIndex field is set to valid indices for the color field. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each vertex in the order given by the colorIndex field. Lines are drawn and color in counter-clockswise direction (starting from the bottom rightmost direction). Used colors are (in order) are Red, Green, Blue and Yellow. This test is very similar to "colorIndex_color.x3d" only that in this test the indices in the colorIndex field are not unique.
Page.name: colorIndex_color1
Page.title: color Index color 1
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field set to true and the colorIndex field is set to empty. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each vertex in the order given by the coordIndex. Lines are drawn and color in a counter-clockwise direction (starting with the bottom leftmost vertex). Colors (in used order) are Red, Green, Blue and Yellow.
Page.name: coordIndex_color
Page.title: coord Index color
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This world tests browser ability to draw an IndexedLine set using mostly default values.
Page.name: default_LineSet
Page.title: default Line Set
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Tesf of colorPerVertex field set to false and the colorIndex field is set to empty. Under such conditions the colors are applied to each polyline in the order given by the color node. Lines are drawn and color in a counter-clockwise direction (starting with the bottom leftmost index). Colors (in used order) are Red, Green, Blue and Yellow.
Page.name: empty_colorIndex
Page.title: empty color Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field set to false and the colorIndex field is set to valid indices for each color in the color field. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each polyline in the order given by the colorIndex. Lines are drawn and color in a counter-clockwise direction starting from the bottom leftmost vertex. Colors (in used order) should be Blue, Yellow, Green and Red.
Page.name: filled_colorIndex
Page.title: filled color Index
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of colorPerVertex field set to false and the colorIndex field is set to valid indices for each color in the color field. Under these conditions the colors are applied to each polyline in the order given by the colorIndex. Lines are drawn and color in counter-clockwise direction starting from the bottom rightmost line. Colors (in used order) should be Blue, Yellow, Green and Red. This test is very similar to "filled-colorIndex.xml" only that in this case the not all lines are assigned a distintive index from the ColorIndex.
Page.name: filled_colorIndex1
Page.title: filled color Index 1
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test of parent transformation effect. Two cubes are drawn in the local coordinate system. The one to the left is affected by a parent transformation (rotated along the axis y by 1.5 radians. The one to the right should not be affected by the transformation (not rotated) and should be independent of the other one.
Page.name: parent_transform
Page.title: parent transform
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: This file was provided by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and is part of the X3D Conformance Test Suite, available at http://www.nist.gov/vrml.html The information contained within this file is provided for use in establishing conformance to the ISO VRML97 Specification. Conformance to this test does not imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Page.description: Test minimum requirement of 15000 polylines, using default coloring. wo concentrical circles are drawn on the local coordinate system, each circle contains 7500 points.
Page.name: polylines15000defcolor
Page.title: polylines 15000defcolor
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: This file was provided by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and is part of the X3D Conformance Test Suite, available at http://www.nist.gov/vrml.html The information contained within this file is provided for use in establishing conformance to the ISO VRML97 Specification. Conformance to this test does not imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Page.description: Test 15000 vertices per polyline minimum conformance requirement. 15000 vertices are used to draw a single polyline. No colorIndex is used. The polyline is painted using the diffuseColor of a Material node.
Page.name: vertices15000
Page.title: vertices 15000
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test multiple colors. A set of multicolor stars are drawn in the local coordinate system. The number of points in the Color node is exactly the same as the number of coordinates in the coord field.
Page.name: mixcolors
Page.title: mixcolors
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test more colors than points. A cube grid using the same color (red) to paint all the points in the PointSet. The number of points in the Color node is higher than the number of coordinates in the coord field.
Page.name: morecolors
Page.title: morecolors
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: This file was provided by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and is part of the X3D Conformance Test Suite, available at http://www.nist.gov/vrml.html The information contained within this file is provided for use in establishing conformance to the ISO VRML97 Specification. Conformance to this test does not imply recommendation or endorsement by the National Institute of Standards and Technology. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Page.description: Test minimum requirement of 5000 points per PointSet. 5000 points are used to draw a cube grid using the same color for each side (red) to paint all the points in the PointSet.
Page.name: points5000
Page.title: points 5000
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test same number of colors as points. A cube grid using the same color (red) to paint all the points in the PointSet. The number of points in the Color node is exactly the same as the number of coordinates in the coord field.
Page.name: samecolor
Page.title: samecolor
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test unlit, uncolored geometry. No Material node, no Color node and no texture is applied to a row of geometry primitives, followed by a row containing an Extrusion, an ElevationGrid and and IndexedFaceSet. As a result, geometry should be displayed as white (1, 1, 1), and completely opaque, and have no material properties.
Page.name: unlit
Page.title: unlit
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test a default Sphere. A simple sphere that tests the default condition. The sphere should be centered at the origin in the local coordinate system with a radius of 1.
Page.name: default_sphere
Page.title: default sphere
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test non-default Sphere values. A simple sphere that specifies values other than the default for radius field.
Page.name: extents
Page.title: extents
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: A default sphere with a simple imagetexture applied. The texture should cover the entire surface, and wrap counterclockwise from the back of the sphere, beginning should appear upright, and vertically centered on the sphere when viewed from the front.
Page.name: texture
Page.title: texture
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to write the "The VRML Test Suite" string by using mostly default values. Only the string field is modified. The rest of the fields are assigned their default values (maxExtent = 0, length = 0,and FontStyle = NULL)
Page.name: default_text
Page.title: default text
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to write a string made of 100 characters, as required by the VRML specification. The test should write the letters from A thru Z (upper case) twice, it should also write the lower case letters a thru v twice, letters from w thru z should appear only once.
Page.name: hundred_charsperstring
Page.title: hundred charsperstring
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to write 100 strings, as required by the VRML specification. The test should write the strings "string 1", "string 2" thru "string 100".
Page.name: hundred_strings
Page.title: hundred strings
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the string field to four character strings ("THE", "VRML", "TEST", "SUITE"). Each string is assigned a different length value in the length field causing the string to be compresed, expanded. The strings The strings "THE" and "TEST" should be expanded while the strings "VRML" and "SUITE" should be compressed.
Page.name: mix_compexp
Page.title: mix compexp
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test attempts to write the four character strings. "The", "VRML", "Test", "Suite" using mostly default values. Only the string field is modified. The rest of the fields are assigned their default values (maxExtent = 0, length = 0,and fontStyle = NULL)
Page.name: mult_strings
Page.title: mult strings
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the value of the length field to 7. This should cause the string "The VRML Test Suite" to be compressed. Units of measure are assumed to be in the standard form (linear measured in meters, angles in radians, and time in seconds)
Page.name: set_length_comp
Page.title: set length comp
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test sets the value of the length field to 25. This should cause the string "The VRML Test Suite" to be stretched. Units of measure are assumed to be in the standard form (linear measured in meters, angles in radians, and time in seconds)
Page.name: set_length_exp
Page.title: set length exp
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test hight maxExtent value. This test assign four character strings to the string field. The strings are "THE", "VRML", "TEST","SUITE". The maxExtent field is set to 10. This value is higher than the length of any of the strings in the string field, therefore none of the strings should be altered (compressed or expanded) by this value.
Page.name: set_maxExtent_high
Page.title: set max Extent high
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test low maxExtent value. This test assign four character strings to the string field. The strings are "THE", "VRML", "TEST", "SUITE". The maxExtent field is set to 3.0 meters. This should cause any strings longer than 3.0 VRML units to be compressed to 3.0 units long.
Page.name: set_maxExtent_low
Page.title: set max Extent low
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests check the boundary condition of 500 children per grouping node. An Anchor node is defined with 500 children in its "children" field. Section 7.3 (Minimum Support Requirements) of the VRML specifications 500 children within a single grouping node. The test should generate 500 default color spheres and radius 0.3
Page.name: bound_500
Page.title: bound 500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This file is referenced by the "invalid_url" file as part of the invalid URL test. This file in particular should generate a blue box with some text on top of it.
Page.name: existing_file
Page.title: existing file
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to ignore a reference to a non existing viewpoint. The test should generate some text and a sphere. The sphere is a child of an Anchor node whose url field contains a reference to a viewpoint name that does not exists. The browser should ignore that reference and nothing should happen when the user clicks on the sphere.
Page.name: invalid_viewpoint
Page.title: invalid viewpoint
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines an Anchor node whose url field is in turn another Anchor node. The test should generate a red sphere with some text on top. After the user clicks on the sphere, the browser should bring up a red box with some text on top. After the user clicks on the red box, the browser should bring up a blue box with some text on top of it. No viewpoints are associated with the url fields.
Page.name: nested_anchor
Page.title: nested anchor
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: new_world
Page.title: new world
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: singleurl
Page.title: singleurl
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used for other tests of the Anchor node.
Page.name: test_anchorclick
Page.title: test anchorclick
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test an Anchor with a Viewpoint. This test defines an Anchor node with a Shape node in its children (Text geometry). It references the fiie "test_viewanchor.x3d" its "url" field with user clicks on the text when the test is first started. A new viewpoint cone and the box are displayed.
Page.name: test_anchorviewpoint
Page.title: test anchorviewpoint
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Viewpoint.description: [17] test_anchorviewpoint.x3d Front view of referenced file

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test bounding box parsing only. An Anchor node with a Shape node (IndexedFaceSet geometry) as a child is defined in the local coordinate system. A bboxSize of 2 2 2 and a bboxCenter of 0 0 0 is given to the Anchor node. The browser should parse the Anchor node without logo mapped to the front.
Page.name: test_bboxsizesame
Page.title: test bboxsizesame
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to nest multiple Anchor nodes in the children field of a parent Anchor node. This test defines an Anchor node with three Shape nodes as children (within another Anchor node). Each child is associated with a different url. The files referenced in the url fields are stored in the same directory where the calling Anchor file is. The test should generate a blue box if the first sphere is clicked, a blue cone if the second one is clicked and a blue cylinder if the third one is clicked. No viewpoints are associated with the url fields.
Page.name: test_mult_multurl
Page.title: test mult multurl
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test an Anchor to a single URL. This test defines an Anchor node with three Shape node as children. All children are associated with the same url. It basically test the ability of a browser to associate a single url entry with multiple blue box (with some text on top of it). No viewpoints are associated
Page.name: test_mult_singleurl
Page.title: test mult singleurl
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test a simple Anchor reference, no viewpoints are used in the URL field. This defines an Anchor node with a Shape node as its child. with some text on top of it. When the user clikcs on the sphere, the browser should bring up another world consisting of a red box and some text on top of it.
Page.name: test_simpleAnchor
Page.title: test simple Anchor
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: test_viewanchor
Page.title: test viewanchor
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to bind a viewpoint to the current world by using the url field of an Anchor node. The test should generate some text whose viewpoint is changed to 0 0 20 when the user clicks on it.
Page.name: test_viewpointonly
Page.title: test viewpointonly
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file referenced by the "new_world.x3d" file as part of the "Anchor referencing another Anchor" test. This file in particular should generate a blue box with some text on top of it.
Page.name: third_world
Page.title: third world
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: url1
Page.title: url 1
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: url2
Page.title: url 2
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This is a collateral file used in other tests for this node.
Page.name: url3
Page.title: url 3
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a Billboard node with two shapes (two Boxes and text) with a rotation axis about all axis (special value of 0 0 0 for the axisOfRotation field). The Billboard should always face the viewer when rotated along any axis. The test should generate a Billboard consisting of two boxes and the string of text "Viewer-alignment".
Page.name: axis_rotall
Page.title: axis rotall
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests defines a Billboard node with three shapes (two Boxes and text) with a rotation axis about the X axis. The Billboard should always face the viewer when moving along the X axis. The test should generate a Billboard consisting of two boxes and the string of text "X as rotation axis".
Page.name: axis_rotX
Page.title: axis rot X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests defines a Billboard node with three shapes (two Boxes and text) with a rotation axis about the Y axis. The Billboard should always face the viewer when moving along the Y axis. The test should generate a Billboard consisting of two boxes and the string of text "Y as rotation axis".
Page.name: axis_rotY
Page.title: axis rot Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests defines a Billboard node with three shapes (two Boxes and text) with a rotation axis about the Z axis. The Billboard should always face the viewer when moving along the Z axis. The test should generate a Billboard consisting of two boxes and the string of text "Z as rotation axis".
Page.name: axis_rotZ
Page.title: axis rot Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Viewpoint.description: [18] axis_rotZ.x3d Front view with no rotation
[19] axis_rotZ.x3d Front view with rotation of -1.57 radians
[20] axis_rotZ.x3d Front view with rotation of -3.14 radians
[21] axis_rotZ.x3d Front view with rotation of 1.57 radians

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests check the boundary condition of 500 children per grouping node. A Billboard is defined with 500 children in its "children" field. Section 7.3 (Minimum Support Requirements) of the VRML specifications 500 children within a single grouping node. The test should generate 500 default color spheres and radius 0.3 meters.
Page.name: bound_500
Page.title: bound 500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test bounding box parsing only. A Billboard node with a Shape node (IndexedFaceSet geometry) as a child is defined in the local coordinate system. A bboxSize of 2 2 2 and a bboxCenter of 0 0 0 is given to the Billboard node. The browser should parse the Anchor node without error and display the IndexedFaceSet geometry
Page.name: test_bboxsizesame
Page.title: test bboxsizesame
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: A Collision node with a Shape node as a child is defined in the local coordinate system. A bboxSize of 2 2 2 and a bboxCenter of 0 0 0 is given to the Collision node. The browser should parse the Collision node without error and provide collision detection, as evident by the Box colliding with the viewer and turning a red color through both navigation and geometry collision with a stationary viewer avatar.
Page.name: boundingBox
Page.title: bounding Box
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests check the minimum conformance requirement of 500 children per grouping node. A Collision node is defined with 500 children in its "children" field. Section 7.3 (Minimum Support Requirements) of the VRML specifications 500 children within a single grouping node. The test should generate 500 default spheres, which will turn a red color when any of them collide with the viewers avatar both through geometry movement (initially scripted using a PositionInterpolator), or through viewer navigation and direct collision. Modified by: Michael Kass 2/16/99 - Added collision detection (color change for all geometry)
Page.name: children500
Page.title: children 500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test a collide value of false. A Collision node with a collide value of false has Shape node containing primitive geometry as its children. In addition the "root" Collision node has child Collision node with collide values of "true" for an IndexedFaceSet, an ElevationGrid and Extrusion geomtry children. Because collide is false for the root Collide node, collisions between the viewer avatar and geometry are not detected, and the viewer should be able to "enter" and "move through" all geometry.
Page.name: collidefalse
Page.title: collidefalse
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test default Collision properties. A default Collision node is the parent of a Box geometry. To test collision support, the BOX geometry collides with the viewer avatar. The Box should turn red upon collision, showing that collision detection between a moving geometry, and a stationary avatar is supported. In addition, the viewer should be able to navigate toward the Box geometry in a "walking" type of motion, and collide with the Box geometry. This should also cause the Box to turn red, indicating that collision detection between a stationary geometry and a moving (navigating) avatar is supported.
Page.name: default_collision
Page.title: default collision
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser behavior with no Collision node present. No Collision node are present in this world. By default, a browser should detect collisions, and not allow a navigating avatar to "enter" any primitive geometry IndexedFaceSet, ElevationGrid or Extrusion geometry.
Page.name: nocollision
Page.title: nocollision
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test proxy support. A default Collision node is the parent of a Box geometry. To test proxy collision support, a Sphere geometry proxy collides with a stationary viewer avatar. The Sphere lineset should turn yellow upon viewer collision with the Sphere proxy, showing that collision detection between a moving proxy geometry, and a stationary avatar is supported. In addition, the viewer should be able to navigate toward the Sphere proxy geometry in a "walking" type of motion, and collide with the Sphere proxy. This should also cause the Sphere lineset to turn yellow, indicating that collision detection between a stationary proxy geometry and a moving (navigating) avatar is supported. In addition the viewer avatar should not be able to "enter" the proxy Sphere geometry when the viewer navigates into the proxy geometry.
Page.name: proxy
Page.title: proxy
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test proxy collision support with no children. A default Collision node is a parent of NO CHILDREN node. To test proxy collision support, a Sphere geometry proxy collides with a stationary viewer avatar. A Sphere lineset (that is not a child of the Collision node) should turn yellow upon viewer collision with the Sphere proxy, showing that collision detection between a moving proxy geometry, and a stationary avatar is supported, even if the Collision node has no children. In addition, the viewer should be able to navigate toward the Sphere proxy geometry in a "walking" type of motion, and collide with the Sphere proxy. This should also cause the Sphere lineset to turn yellow, indicating that collision detection between a stationary proxy geometry and a moving (navigating) avatar is supported, even if the Collision node has no children. In addition, the vewer avatar should NOT be able to "enter" the proxy Sphere geometry when navigating.
Page.name: proxynochildren
Page.title: proxynochildren
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests check the boundary condition of 500 children per grouping node. A Group is defined with 500 children in its "children" field. Section 7.3 (Minimum Support Requirements) of the VRML specifications 500 children within a single grouping node. The test should generate 500 default color spheres and radius 0.3 meters.
Page.name: bound_500
Page.title: bound 500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test bboxSize parsing only. A Group node with a Shape node (IndexedFaceSet geometry) as a child is defined in the local coordinate system. A bboxSize of 2 2 2 and a bboxCenter of 0 0 0 is given to the Group node. The browser should parse the Group node without error and display the IndexedFaceSet
Page.name: test_bboxsizesame
Page.title: test bboxsizesame
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This tests check the boundary condition of 500 children per grouping node. A Transform is defined with 500 children in its "children" field. Section 7.3 (Minimum Support Requirements) of the VRML specifications 500 children within a single grouping node. The test should generate 500 default color spheres and radius 0.3 meters.
Page.name: bound_500
Page.title: bound 500
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test bboxSize parsing only. An Anchor node with a Shape node (IndexedFaceSet geometry) as a child is defined in the local coordinate system. A bboxSize of 2 2 2 and a bboxCenter of 0 0 0 is given to the Anchor node. The browser should parse the Anchor node without error and display the IndexedFaceSet geometry
Page.name: test_bboxsizesame
Page.title: test bboxsizesame
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a Transform that specifies an offset along the X axis from the center of the local coordinate system. The test should draw three cylinders, one at the center of the local coordinate system and two more on top of it but rotated 1.57 radians along the X axis resulting in a cross like figure.
Page.name: test_centerX
Page.title: test center X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a Transform that specifies an offset along the Y axis from the center of the local coordinate system. The test should draw three cylinders, one at the center of the local coordinate system, one at the bottom and one at the top rotated 1.57 radians along the Z axis. following is the main parent transform with center at origin.
Page.name: test_centerY
Page.title: test center Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a Transform that specifies an offset along the Z axis from the center of the local coordinate system. The test should draw three cylinders one at the center of the local coordinate system and two on top of it and rotated 1.57 radians along the Z axis resulting on cross like figure.
Page.name: test_centerZ
Page.title: test center Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test natural order of transformation. This test defines a single Transform with all its fields assigned some values. This test is designed to check the natural order of the transformation operations. The natural order of the transformation operations is: center, scaleOrientation, rotation and translation. The test should generate a multicolor IndexedFaceSet (cube shaped).
Page.name: test_equivalence
Page.title: test equivalence
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test addresses the importance of the transformation order when drawing a figure. The test draws the same figure twice, however the transformation order is different for each one. The leftmost one uses the following order to draw the figure: scaleOrientation, scale, translation and rotation. The rightmost figure uses the following order: scaleOrientation, rotation, translation and scale. This will result on the left figure being longest along the Y axis and the right figure being longest along the X axis.
Page.name: test_order
Page.title: test order
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that rotates a multicolor IndexedFaceSet around the X axis. The test should generate a sequence of the same IndexedFaceSet rotating about the X axis.
Page.name: test_rotationX
Page.title: test rotation X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that rotates an IndexedFaceSet around the Y axis. The test should generate a sequence of the same IndexedFaceSet (cube shaped) rotating about the Y axis. Each side of the face is painted with a different color to identify each face more easily.
Page.name: test_rotationY
Page.title: test rotation Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that rotates an IndexedFaceSet around the Z axis. The test should generate a sequence of the same multicolor IndexedFaceSet rotating about the Z axis.
Page.name: test_rotationZ
Page.title: test rotation Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales down a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 0.2 along the X axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that get thiner from left to right. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaledownX
Page.title: test scaledown X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales down a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 0.2 along the Y axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that get thinner from top to bottom. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaledownY
Page.title: test scaledown Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales down a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 0.2 along the Z axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that get thiner from front to back. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaledownZ
Page.title: test scaledown Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to set different values for the X portion of the scaleOrientation field. Two Transforms with the same scale factor (1 2 3) are defined in the local coordinate system. The test is started by clicking on the text above the geometry. The scaleOrientation value is changed for the right figure only as the animation progresses from an original value of 0 to 1.57 along the X axis. (no changes should be done to the left figure at all). After the animation finishes, the test test should have generated two red boxes, the one to the left should be twice as high as it is wide and three times as deep as it is wide. The righmost one should be twice as deep as it is wide and three times as high as it is wide.
Page.name: test_scaleorientX
Page.title: test scaleorient X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to set different values for the Y portion of the scaleOrientation field. Two Transforms with the same scale factor (1 2 3) are defined in the local coordinate system. The test is started by clicking on the text above the geometry. The scaleOrientation value is changed for the right figure only as the animation progresses from an original value of 0 to 1.57 along the Y axis. (no changes should be done to the left figure at all). After the animation finishes, the test test should have generated two red boxes, the one to the left should be twice as high as it is wide and three times as deep as it is wide. The righmost one should be twice as deep as it is wide and three time as high as it is wide.
Page.name: test_scaleorientY
Page.title: test scaleorient Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: Test browser to set different values for the Z portion of the scaleOrientation field. Two Transforms with the same scale factor (1 2 3) are defined in the local coordinate system. The test is started by clicking on the text above the geometry. The scaleOrientation value is changed for the right figure only as the animation progresses from an original value of 0 to 1.57 along the Z axis. (no changes should be done to the left figure at all). After the animation finishes, the test test should have generated two red boxes, the one to the left should be twice as high as it is wide and three times as deep as it is wide. The righmost one should be twice as deep as it is wide and three time as high as it is wide.
Page.name: test_scaleorientZ
Page.title: test scaleorient Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales down a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 2.0 along the X axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that gets wider from left to right. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaleupX
Page.title: test scaleup X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales up a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 2.0 along the Y axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that get longer from top to bottom. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaleupY
Page.title: test scaleup Y
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that scales up a Sphere from its original size to a factor a 2.0 along the Z axis. The should generate a sequence of the same sphere that get longer from front to back. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_scaleupZ
Page.title: test scaleup Z
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that translates a cylinder along the X axis. The test should generate a sequence of the same cylinder translated along the the X axis. The default color is used.

Page.title: test translation X
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.creator: http://www.itl.nist.gov/div897/ctg/vrml/members.html
Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that translates a sphere along the X, Y plane. The test should generate a sequence of the same sphere translated along the the X, Y plane forming a circular shape. The default color is used.
Page.name: test_translationXY
Page.title: test translation XY
Page.translator: Michael Kass NIST, Don Brutzman NPS

Page.description: This test defines a series of Transforms that translates a cylinder along the Y axis. The test should generate a sequence of the same cylinder translated along the the Y axis. The default color is used.
